laboratory_examinations.findings: Multiple foci of uptake in the ribs, particularly on the left anterolaterally.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: FDG-PET scan was performed 17 days after fracture. CT scans 35 days after revealed healing fractures with callus formation. Ten months later, a bone scan showed faint uptake in the three left ribs, consistent with old healing fractures.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Low-grade diffuse uptake in the left upper lobe consistent with inflammation and uptake in several ribs bilaterally.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan confirmed the presence of healing fractures, with callus formation corresponding to the FDG-PET abnormality.
Five weeks after the fall, a bone scan showed increased tracer uptake, and FDG-PET performed 8 weeks after the fall showed normal findings.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Pulmonary nodule metabolically active with low-grade activity in two foci in the lower left lateral chest wall corresponding to rib fractures.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Fractures presumably sustained during cardiopulmonary resuscitation 1 month before the PET scan.
